name: Accelerated First-Year Telugu
description: Six lecture hours a week for one semester. Telugu 604 and 506 may not both be counted; Telugu 604 and 507 may not both be counted.

name: First-Year Telugu I
description: Not open to native speakers of Telugu.  Five class hours a week for one semester. Telugu 604 and 506 may not both be counted.

name: First-Year Telugu II
description: Not open to native speakers of Telugu.  Five class hours a week for one semester. Telugu 604 and 507 may not both be counted. Prerequisite: Telugu 506 with a grade of at least C.

name: Accelerated Second-Year Telugu
description: Continuation of Telugu 604. Six lecture hours a week for one semester. Telugu 612 and 312K may not both be counted; Telugu 612 and 312L may not both be counted. Prerequisite: Telugu 604.

name: Second-Year Telugu I
description: Not open to native speakers of Telugu.  Three lecture hours a week for one semester. Telugu 612 and 312K may not both be counted. Prerequisite: Telugu 507 with a grade of at least C.

name: Second-Year Telugu II
description: Not open to native speakers of Telugu.  Three lecture hours a week for one semester. Telugu 612 and 312L may not both be counted. Prerequisite: Telugu 312K with a grade of at least C.

name: Practice in Spoken Telugu
description: Not open to native speakers of Telugu. Instruction and practice in conversation for intermediate-level students. Two lecture hours a week for one semester. Prerequisite: Telugu 507 with a grade of at least C.

name: Practice in Spoken Telugu II
description: Not open to native speakers of Telugu. Instruction and practice in conversation for intermediate-level students. Two lecture hours a week for one semester. Prerequisite: Telugu 312K or 118K with a grade of at least C.

name: Telugu Language and Literature
description: Three lecture hours a week for one semester. Prerequisite: Telugu 312L with a grade of at least C.

name: Conference Course in Telugu Language and Literature
description: Individual instruction.  May be repeated for credit. Prerequisite: Upper-division standing and written consent of instructor on form obtained from the undergraduate adviser.
